description:
Company: Third Way Health, Inc.

Job: Director of Patient Experience & Quality Assurance

Location: Los Angeles, California

Who we are:

Third Way Health (www.thirdway.health) helps medical practices and healthcare organizations across the United States to improve the patient experience while reducing the administrative burden on practice owners and management. We enable practices and healthcare organizations to enhance the experience of their patients by providing them with a leading technology platform and world-class services. What unites us is our passion to support physicians and help patients from all backgrounds to have a better healthcare experience.

About the position:

Third Way Health is seeking an experienced and dynamic Vice President of Partnerships to drive our business growth. In this pivotal role, you'll be at the forefront of forging strategic partnerships with health systems, payers, MSOs, and other key stakeholders, navigating complex multi-stakeholder deals that are crucial for our success. As a leader within a fast-paced startup environment, you will not only spearhead our partnership efforts but also inspire and guide our Business Development Representatives and Demand Generation teams, ensuring they are aligned and equipped to meet the ambitious objectives we've set. If you're a strategic thinker with a proven track record in high-stakes negotiation and team leadership, and you're ready to make a significant impact in a company that's at the cutting edge of healthcare innovation, we'd love to hear from you.

Responsibilities:
• Identify, negotiate, and close complex multi-stakeholder dollar with health systems, payers, MSOs, and other significant stakeholders in the healthcare industry
• Develop and execute a comprehensive partnership strategy that aligns with Third Way Health's mission and growth objectives
• Lead and empower the BDR and Demand Generation teams, providing strategic direction, support, and mentorship to achieve sales targets and expand market presence
• Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with key decision-makers and influencers within the healthcare sector
• Analyze market trends and competitor activities to identify new partnership opportunities and areas for growth
• Work closely with cross-functional teams, including product, marketing, and operations, to ensure seamless integration and execution of partnership agreements
• Represent Third Way Health at industry events, conferences, and networking functions, enhancing the company's visibility and reputation in the market

Requirements:
• Proven track record of negotiating and closing complex deals in the healthcare sector, with a strong preference for experience with health systems, payers, and MSOs
• Minimum of 6 years of relevant experience in business development, partnerships, or sales within the healthcare industry
• Demonstrated ability to lead and motivate sales and marketing teams in a startup environment, with a hands-on approach to leadership
• Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage and influence senior executives and stakeholders
• Strong analytical and strategic thinking skills, with the ability to translate complex concepts into actionable plans
• Bachelor's degree in Business, Healthcare Administration, or a related field; MBA or other advanced degree is preferred
• Willingness to travel as needed to meet with partners, attend events, and drive business opportunities

Benefits & Perks We Offer:
• The opportunity to directly improve the healthcare experience for hundreds of thousands of patients
• A dynamic, growing organization with ongoing development opportunities
• A multicultural environment with offices in 2 countries
• Competitive Benefits package (incl. Healthcare, vision, and dental insurance)
• Unlimited PTO for vacation, sick and mental health days–we encourage everyone to take at least 20 days of vacation per year to ensure dedicated time to spend with loved ones, explore, rest and recharge

Compensation:

Total on target earnings (OTE) for this role is $200-450k annually, depending on candidate qualifications and experience, and revenue generated
